Operation 'get_/bin/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is vague ('Return' is passive). Description is completely missing, leaving AI agents unable to understand what data is returned, what parameters are required, or error conditions. Added clarity on retrieval action, required input (bin ID), and expected output (JSON object).

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a JSON bin by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a stored JSON bin by its unique identifier. Returns the complete JSON object stored in the bin. Requires a valid bin ID in the path parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague ('Return' is passive). Description is completely missing, leaving AI agents unable to understand what data is returned, what parameters are required, or error conditions. Added clarity on retrieval action, required input (bin ID), and expected output (JSON object).

message: Operation 'put_/bin/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary lacks specificity about replacement semantics. Description is missing entirely. AI agents need to understand that PUT replaces entire contents (not partial updates), what request body is expected, what is returned, and that this is a destructive operation. Added these critical details.

data.description_suggestion: Replaces the entire contents of an existing JSON bin with new data. Requires the bin ID in the path and a JSON payload in the request body. Returns the updated bin with the new contents. This operation completely overwrites the previous bin data.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks specificity about replacement semantics. Description is missing entirely. AI agents need to understand that PUT replaces entire contents (not partial updates), what request body is expected, what is returned, and that this is a destructive operation. Added these critical details.

message: Operation 'patch_/bin/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary mentions JSON Merge Patch but description is empty. AI agents need to understand the merge semantics, what request format is expected, which fields get modified, and what is returned. Added details about RFC 7386 compliance, partial update behavior, and response format.

data.current_summary: Partially update a json bin with JSON Merge Patch
data.summary_suggestion: Partially update a JSON bin using merge patch
data.description_suggestion: Performs a partial update of a JSON bin using JSON Merge Patch (RFC 7386). Requires the bin ID in the path and a JSON patch object in the request body. Only specified fields are modified; unspecified fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated bin with merged contents.
data.reasoning: Summary mentions JSON Merge Patch but description is empty. AI agents need to understand the merge semantics, what request format is expected, which fields get modified, and what is returned. Added details about RFC 7386 compliance, partial update behavior, and response format.

message: Operation 'delete_/bin/{id}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary lacks emphasis on permanence. Description is missing, leaving AI agents uncertain about destructiveness, what happens to the data, and what response to expect. Added clarity on irreversibility, required input, and response format.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a JSON bin and all its contents. Requires the bin ID in the path parameter. This operation is irreversible. Returns a deletion confirmation status.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks emphasis on permanence. Description is missing, leaving AI agents uncertain about destructiveness, what happens to the data, and what response to expect. Added clarity on irreversibility, required input, and response format.

data.description_suggestion: Creates a new JSON bin to store JSON data. Requires a JSON payload in the request body containing the data to store. Returns the created bin with a unique identifier (ID) that can be used for subsequent retrieval, update, or deletion operations.
